messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:01): do adjacent text nodes have implicit whitespace between the two?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:02): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: see the email I sent?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:16): they do not
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:19): that's what I expected
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:19): Why would (in Python) `else Element.textContent:` cause a syntaxerror?
b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c (23:20): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: elif
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:20): b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c: oh duh.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:20): headdesks
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:20): thx
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:20): This is not the syntax you're looking for *handwave*
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:21): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: hey! I'm allowed to be dumb at times! :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:21): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: don't be mean to the kid!
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:22): I'm just trying to lighten the mood with some humor
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:23): And I'm being totally serious :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:23): (obviously)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:23): </sarcasm>
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:23): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: what? you think you need a start tag! Silly XML making you think such things.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:23): <sarcasm> is an optional start tag
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:24): like <html>, <head>, and <body>
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:24): actually saw a real site which omitted the opening head tag, but not the closing one, a few weeks ago
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:24): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Since when is IRC sent as text/html? :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:25): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: it's text/plain;charset=unknown, so why any parser error ever? :P
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:26): I have to parse your writing to understand it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:26): peh!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:26): parsing is overrated.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:27): wow, the whatwg copy of html5 sure has dropped down the rankings
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:27): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: talking of HTML 5, you have any need for ul.toc on _every_ nested ul in the TOC?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:28): actually, why isn't it an ol?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:29): no idea on either point
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:29): it should be an ol, no?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:29): probably
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:30): goes back to designing an algorithm to actually create the TOC
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:30): the html5 spec has one of those :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:31): though it's hard to understand
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:31): it does?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:31): oh, that one
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:31): totally forgot
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:33): the creating an outline section?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:34): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, the proxy script you sent me doesn't correctly pass the username and password
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:34): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: I just realised that
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:36): has an imp. of the HTML 5 algorithm somewhere but doesn't recommend it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:39): emails f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 the "don't write PHP scripts quickly thinking you can write them fine" edition.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:39): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: the alg, or the results?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:40): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: What do you mean results?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:40): I think the algorithm does the right thing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:40): that's what i meant by results
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:42): I mostly meant that I don't recommend my implementation, although I have no particular love for the way the algorithm is expressed either
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:42): is scratching his head at parts of the description
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:43): bbl
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:43): bye
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:45): (I actually meant creating the actual TOC output, not creating it internally, but hey)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:47): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, you still didn't get it quite right :-)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:47): but I fixed it
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:47): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: what now?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:47): oh. ).
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:47): it all works
